title: What primary school did you attend? - Quora

response.answer_text: I was pretty much at a different school every year when I was in elementary school and 3 different schools when I was in middle school. In Kindergarten I went to Sparta Elementary in Belton, Texas. I went to Buidigen Elementary in Germany for 1st Grade. I was homeschooled for 2nd and most of 3rd Grade. I went to J. L. Williams Elementary in Copperas Cove, Texas for 4th Grade. I went to Clear Creek Elementary in Fort Hood, Texas for 5th Grade. I went to Smith Middle School in Fort Hood, Texas for 6th Grade. I went to Alconbury High School in Alconbury, England for the first half of my 7th Grade year and Palo Alto Middle School in Killeen, Texas for the second half of my 7th Grade year. I went to Palo Alto Middle School in Killeen, Texas for 8th Grade.

I attended St. John’s Elementary School in Independence, Iowa, from 1st grade through 6th grade. Prior to that I attended kindergarten at Washington Elementary in Miss Walsh’s class. And before that, my mother took me along with her to her kindergarten teacher job at Hawthorne Elementary on the other side of town (I was 4), because it was cheaper and easier than getting a babysitter, I’m guessing. Plus, I was already reading, having taught myself using my 4-years-older sister’s books. After sixth grade, I transferred to Jefferson High School, the local public school. Our band was just named one of the best marching bands in the nation and, even then, we had an outstanding band under director Glen Miller (no; not THAT Glen Miller.) Independence High School marching band places at national competition
